intro: Anagallis arvensis f. caerulea, commonly known as the blue-eyed weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features slender, trailing stems and produces small, showy flowers with blue or violet petals. Its flowers are characterized by a central yellow eye, which gives it its common name. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a ground cover.
